intro: Oftia africana, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. Its root system is fibrous, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans if ingested.
